criterion: Reward for clearly documenting in HistoryOfPresentIllness that the patient missed one warfarin dose last week, experienced no new symptoms, and that his daughter helped him resume therapy
Reward for including an Instruct or Task entry that details specific adherence aids (weekly pill box and phone/alert reminders) with an assigned person (patient or daughter) and timeframe

Reward for documenting an anticoagulation safety plan that covers at least one of the following: patient education not to double warfarin doses, bleeding‐risk warning signs and when to seek care, or instructions to contact clinic if another dose is missed
Reward for ordering or scheduling a follow-up INR test within guideline time-frame (≤4 weeks) and explicitly stating that current warfarin dosing will be maintained unless INR indicates otherwise
Reward for capturing relevant social context (daughter’s involvement and patient’s openness to technology) in Social History or appropriate free text without redundancy
Penalize for inclusion of chart data or narrative unrelated to the transcript (e.g., copying full past medical history, allergies, or review of systems) that does not advance the current encounter

Penalize for misusing Canvas instruction types (e.g., combining multiple instructions in one, omitting required single-instruction categories, or placing content in an incorrect category such as safety plan in HistoryOfPresentIllness)
